folder: Chambers Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
120 Chambers Street, south side, east of West Broadway, showing the 5-story structure occupied by J. Newton Van Ness Company. See No. 50 Warren Street for the other side of this structure that has entrances on both streets.

May 19, 1905.

Wurtz Brothers.

folder: West Broadway & Chambers Street, Manhattan, NY
text:

October 15, 1914

text:

folder: Chambers Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
(1)
An aerial view of 129-117 Chambers Street, at, adjoining, and east of the N.E. corner of West Broadway. The view also shows West Broadway, east side, from Chambers to Reade Streets.
February 11, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

(2)
117-129 Chambers Street, east of, adjoining, and at the N.E. corner of West Broadway. No. 129 is the Cosmopolitan Hotel.
April 19, 1931.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: Chambers Street & West Broadway, Manhattan, NY
text:
Chambers Street, north side, east from West Broadway, The Cosmopolitan Hotel (No. 129) is at the N.E. corner of West Broadway.

April 29, 1935.

P. L. Sperr.

folder: West Broadway & Chambers Street, Manhattan, NY
text:
West Broadway, east side, at Chambers Street, and showing the Cosmopolitan Hotel (the N.E. corner), across the Sixth Ave. Elevated Line. Prominent building shown, is the Woolworth Tower.

December 25, 1936.

P. L. Sperr.

This hotel is about 80 years old, and was the rendezvous of politicians, judges and lawyers. Its owner for many years was the late Joseph M. Weintraub. See the New York Times, November 12, 1937 for an account of a fire that swept the upper floors on the 11th.
